ui_component_localisation.localised_string: Finest china||Present some of your finest china to show goodwill.
Please enter a name for your avatar.
Please enter a name for your general.
Thoroughbred||Offer one of your thoroughbreds, a racing horse and a fine prize.
Jewellery||Send a gift of jewellery to demonstrate the worth you place on your friendship.
No rewards or unlocks have been gained as there was an AI army in the previous battle.

Artillery Cross Fire||This is a formation for an artillery-heavy army. Line infantry are placed in the centre with light infantry on their flanks in support. Artillery is placed on the extreme flanks to provide a crossfire, and cavalry provide support to them. The general is at the back of the formation in the centre.
Bark of the Pine Tree||Cavalry heavy attack formation. Right-click for more information.
Bird Cloud||Medium ships formation. Right-click for more information.

Cavalry Heavy Left||This is a cavalry-heavy formation designed to overload one side of the enemies formation. The centre is line infantry with artillery on the flanks as support. The cavalry is then placed on the extreme left flank and light infantry on the extreme right flank. The general brings up the rear of the army.

Cavalry Heavy Right||This is a cavalry-heavy formation designed to overload one side of the enemies formation. The centre is line infantry with artillery on the flanks as support. The cavalry is then placed on the extreme right flank and light infantry on the extreme left flank. The general brings up the rear of the army.
Cloud Dragon||Missile heavy attack formation. Right-click for more information.
Crane's Wing||Balanced army defence formation. Right-click for more information.
You are about to change religion. You may not revert back until a new daimyo rules the clan. Do you wish to continue?
Your bombardment failed to cause any damage!
You are about to change your allegiance. You will not be able to revert until a new daimyo rules your domain and may experience public order and diplomatic difficulties. Do you wish to continue?

Double Line Standard||This is a balanced army formation, placing line infantry in the centre of the line and artillery in support. Light infantry and cavalry are placed on the flanks. A second line of infantry in the centre helps provide depth and the general is behind this line.
Extended Snake||Balanced ships formation. Right-click for more information.
This tab shows your daimyo and his family, heirs, generals and councillors.||Use the family tree below to select an heir, appoint a council position and marry off your daughters.
Your nation and its leader at the time of saving.
Flying Bird||Missile heavy defence formation. Right-click for more information.
Flying Geese||Cavalry heavy defence formation. Right-click for more information.

Grand Battery||This is a defensive artillery-heavy formation which places all artillery at the front in the centre. Light infantry are placed on the flanks of the artillery, and a line of infantry behind the artillery and light infantry. Cavalry are placed behind both lines on the flanks and the general is behind both lines in the centre.
Left-click to open this message, right-click to dismiss it.

Line Abreast||The line abreast formation arranges your grouped ships into a single line, abreast of each other - hence the name. It will still work with ships that fire broadsides, but you must manually move them into position to fire. Line abreast particularly suits ships with guns mounted in their noses, such as the Kotetsu.

Line Astern||The line astern formation arranges your grouped ships one behind the other. As the ships move past the enemy they will fire off a broadside one by one. This formation particularly suits ships with large numbers of guns on their broadsides.

Taxes map||This shows how your current tax rate is affecting your population's public order.||Green provinces show a population under control, yellow means they are neutral and red means they are unhappy and could revolt.||You can adjust the tax rate with the tax slider below, and the map will update to show the effects.

Melee Frontline||This is an infantry-heavy formation for use with lots of melee units. The melee units are placed in the front and are backed up by line infantry. Artillery are put on the flanks of the melee units and light infantry on the extreme flanks of the formation. Cavalry are placed behind the light infantry. The general is at the back of the formation in the centre.
Reclining Dragon||Melee infantry heavy attack formation. Right-click for more information.
This tab shows details of your clan's victories and defeats and also contains a log of its events.
Spear Point||Balanced army attack formation. Right-click for more information.
The summary tab shows your clan's statistics and details.
This shows a brief overview of the battle, including how many men on each side were killed or captured.

Number of men in this unit.||The maximum number of men you can have in this unit is shown in brackets.||If the unit is missing men you can use the replenish button to maximise the numbers again.||Fresh units will dilute the overall experience of a unit.

Admirals have their own individual traits and abilities depending on their experiences.||Some admirals will be better than others and you may want to move the best of them where they are needed most.||If a fleet has no admiral, the captain of the fleet will be displayed here instead.||Right-click to bring up the details for the selected admiral or captain.||Left-click to jump to his location on the main map.

Your agents with their type shown underneath their name.||Left-click on each agent to jump to their location on the campaign map.||Right-clicking on an agent will bring up their details panel.

Your agents, their movement points, and their location.|| Your agents are gentlemen and spies.|| As your empire expands it can be tough keeping track of all your agents, particularly if they are undercover in an enemy region.|| Use this to pinpoint their location quickly and make the most of your agents!

Sabotage|| Click here once you have chosen your target.|| You will then see the result of the sabotage attempt.|| Skilled spies can perform sabotage and escape with their secret identity intact.|| If this happens the victim's nation will place the blame at the feet of their most hated enemy, and your nation will be overlooked.|| This is a great way to escalate tension between two nations and play them off against each other.|| However, if you are discovered it will adversely affect your diplomatic relations.
Demand surrender||If your forces are powerful enough you can try to demand a surrender.||If the enemy accepts you will be spared a lengthy wait or a bloody battle and losses on both sides.

Click here to get advice about multiplayer.

For one clan to enter another's province, they must request access or declare war.||Military access is for those who wish to cross another's land peacefully.||Of course, this access could be abused and can make the clan that grants it vulnerable to a surprise attack.||For this reason, it can be difficult to negotiate and good relations between the two clans is an important factor.

Breaking a military access deal before the allotted time is up will anger the other clan and reflect poorly on your own.||Word may spread that your clan does not honour it's promises, making it harder to negotiate in future. ||However, if you feel the other clan is untrustworthy, cancelling it may save you from a surprise attack.
Allies can be asked for help in the event of war.||It is useful to be on friendly terms with a clan before requesting an alliance.
If an alliance is no longer in your clan's best interests, it would be wise to end it.||However, this can make your clan seem dishonourable to others and make future diplomatic negotiations harder.

You can ask that a clan breaks its alliance with another.||This is useful if they an ally of one of your enemies.||The proposal is more likely to be accepted if they value your friendship over the other's.
You can ask a clan to join you in a trade embargo against another clan.||This is a good way of depriving an enemy of essential funds.

Family members can be exchanged or given as hostages as a guarantee to an agreement.||Hostages can be used when it is hard to gain the trust of the other clan.||After eight turns, if the deal has been honoured, the hostage will be freed. If the deal is not honoured, they will be killed.
Marriage between clans can improve and strengthen relations.
You can demand or offer payments and choose to make them a single or regular tribute.
Peace can sometimes prove more profitable than war.||If you are at peace with a clan, you may be able to open up a trade agreement with them or even gain an ally.

If a clan looks weak, you can offer to make them a vassal to your own clan.||This means you will have to protect them when they are attacked, but will not have to join any wars they start.||In return, you receive a regular payment from them and unlimited access to their lands.
Request a clan to join you as an ally in war.||If you are the attacker, they can turn you down without breaking the alliance between you.

You can ask that a clan changes its policy towards another.||This is useful if they are aiding one of your enemies.||The proposal is more likely to be accepted if they value your friendship over the other's.

Trading can provide valuable income for your clan.||To trade with another clan, you will need a trade route access to their capital.||For land trade, this means you need to share a border or have acquired military access through any other provinces standing between your two clans.||For naval trade, both clans must have a port in their capital.
This will close all trade routes between the two clans.||Though you will lose all trade from them, it also denies them any trade income from you.
Declaring war will end any agreements with this clan.||It can sometimes lose you deals with other clans as well, as they pick sides.

The archery dojo in this province allows recruitment not only of the inferior bow ashigaru available to all lords, but also of the far more skillful bow samurai. This knowledge and expertise can be combined with the teachings of other archery dojos to quickly enable access to the most powerful archers available. Situated on the island of Shikoku, with excellent access to several sea regions, the opening of new sea routes will quickly be rewarded with a wider range of coastal assault options, allowing for a flexible strategy.

The yari drill yard in this province allows recruitment not only of the inferior yari ashigaru available to all lords, but also of the far more reliable yari samurai. This knowledge and expertise can be combined with the teachings of other yari drill yards to quickly give access to the most powerful spear infantry available. Though this mastery of the spear - the yari - could risk over-reliance on defensive tactics, the close proximity of several workshops will enable acquisition of both siege engines and deadly teppo matchlocks.

The stables in this province allow recruitment not only of poorly armed light cavalry, but also of far more deadly yari cavalry. This knowledge and expertise can be combined with the knowledge collected at other stables to quickly enable the recruitment of new and more powerful cavalry units - a strategy aided by the province's relatively central location.

Musashi is a fertile province situated on the eastern Kanto plains. Its capital, Edo, is home to the Tokugawa Shogunate. The skilled White Tiger Force can be recruited from its Shogunate Armoury. Start here for traditional samurai cunning and skill.

Musashi is a fertile province situated on the eastern Kanto plains. Its capital, Edo, is home to the Tokugawa Shogunate. The skilled Kyoto Police can be recruited from its Shogunate Barracks. Start here for traditional samurai cunning and skill.

The sword school in this province allows recruitment not only of the inferior loan-sword ashigaru, but also of the far more deadly katana samurai. This knowledge and expertise can be combined with the teachings of other sword schools to quickly enable recruitment of the most powerful sword infantry available. The province also lies in an advantageous position for exploring the nearby sake dens, rumoured to be a front for the mysterious kisho ninja.

Nagato, home to part of the southern alliance, is situated on the western-most tip of Honshu. With control over Kyoto and therefore the Imperial Armoury, this province enables the recruitment of skilled Red Bear Infantry. Start here for modernisation, gunpowder and foreign ideas.

Nagato, home to part of the southern alliance, is situated on the western-most tip of Honshu. With control over Kyoto and therefore the Imperial Armoury, this province enables the recruitment of skilled Black Bear Infantry. Start here for modernisation, gunpowder and foreign ideas.

Anti-aliasing smooths out jagged edges on objects e.g. smoother edges to building rooftops.
 MLAA is a cutting-edge shader-based technique, developed in partnership with AMD, that delivers anti-aliasing quality on par with 4X MSAA, at a fraction of the cost.
MSAA is the traditional hardware-accelerated technique for anti-aliasing, while it offers potentially higher quality anti-aliasing than MLAA, at a much higher cost in terms of graphics memory.
MSAA is only available with Shader Model 4.1 or Shader Model 5 selected, and is not available on DirectX 9. 
MLAA is always available.
